From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the revision number for the Multiple Spanning Tree (802.1s) (MST) configuration, use the **revision** command in MST configuration submode. To return to the default settings, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

ExtraInfo: Two CiscoÂ 7600 series routers that have the same configuration but different revision numbers are considered to be part of two different regions.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/caut.gif)---**Caution** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Be careful when using the**revision** command to set the revision number of the MST configuration because a mistake can put the switch in a different region.---

RelatedCmds.description: Maps a VLAN or a set of VLANs to an MST instance.
Sets the name of an MST region.
Displays information about the spanning-tree state.
